BNC User Reference Guide

<shift>

shift marks the point at which some paralinguistic feature of a series of utterances by any one speaker changes.
Class model.divPart.spoken
Declaration 
element shift { attribute new { data.enumerated }?, empty }
Attributes
(In addition to global attributes)
new specifies the new state of the paralinguistic feature specified.
Status: Optional
Datatype (1–1) data.enumerated
Default: normal
Values: An open list (for an example of possible values, see )

If no value is specified, it is assumed that the feature concerned ceases to be remarkable. The value ‘normal’ has the same effect.

Example
 <u who="PS09K"
xmlns:xaira="http://www.xaira.org/ns/1.0/spec"
xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
xmlns:rng="http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0">
  <s n="606">
   <shift new="laughing"/>
   <w c5="ITJ" hw="yeah" pos="INTERJ">Yeah </w>
   <shift/>
  </s>
 </u>
; ;
Module spoken
